description: From tiny ion channels to the basis for learning, neuroscience is a rapidly developing area.  Using
texts, reviews, and current literature, students examine in depth the fundamental unit of the
nervous system, the neuron. The goals are to understand how neurons accomplish their unique
functions: electrical signaling, synaptic transmission, and directed growth and remodeling.
Prerequisites: Biology 125,  or Chemistry/Biology 125-127, and progress towards a major in any of
